alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 07 at 5:05PM CST until March 10 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Arcadia, Dodge...flooding is possible. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. At 11.5 feet, Water covers part of County Road J in Dodge. At 12.0 feet, Low lying roads around Dodge may flood, including County Road P, as well as along a low spot on County Road J south of Dodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Monday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
